title: Power BI Custom Connector & Report Developer
description:
We seek a highly skilled and detail-oriented Power BI Developer with experience building custom connectors, integrating with REST APIs, and designing reusable, scalable report components. This role is ideal for someone who understands the Power BI ecosystem deeply and can architect solutions that are both technically robust and user-friendly.
You will be responsible for developing a custom Power BI connector that authenticates via OAuth, dynamically loads user-specific data, and supports a modular reporting approach that can be reused across multiple reports and users.


 Responsibilities:
•	Design and develop a Power BI custom connector using the Power Query SDK and M language
•	Implement OAuth 2.0 authentication to securely connect to REST APIs
•	Build dynamic navigation tables that adapt to the authenticated user’s available data
•	Create reusable report components (e.g., visuals, logic blocks, templates) that can be deployed across multiple reports
•	Develop and maintain Power BI templates (.PBIT) that support parameterized data sources
•	Automate report deployment and updates using Power BI REST API, PowerShell, or deployment pipelines
•	Ensure that updates to shared components can be centrally managed and propagated efficiently
•	Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into scalable solutions
•	Document connector logic, authentication flows, and deployment procedures


Semantic Modeling & Reusability:
•	Design and maintain Power BI semantic models (formerly datasets) that encapsulate business logic, relationships, and calculations
•	Enable centralized, reusable data models that support multiple reports and users with consistent KPIs and metrics
•	Implement live connections to semantic models to ensure real-time updates and reduce report duplication
•	Use tools like Tabular Editor to manage and version semantic models efficiently
•	Apply row-level security (RLS) and metadata best practices to support secure, user-specific data access


Required Qualifications:
•	Proven experience building Power BI custom connectors using the Power Query SDK
•	Strong proficiency in the M language and Power Query
•	Deep understanding of Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service, and data gateways
•	Experience integrating with REST APIs, including handling authentication, pagination, and error handling
•	Hands-on experience implementing OAuth 2.0 in Power BI connectors
•	Familiarity with Power BI templates, shared datasets, and dataflows
•	Ability to design modular, reusable report components and scalable report architectures
•	Proficiency with Visual Studio and connector packaging (.mez files)


Preferred Skills:
•	Experience with Power BI Embedded, Power Automate, or Power Platform
•	Familiarity with Azure Active Directory and app registrations
•	Knowledge of DAX, Tabular Editor, and calculation groups
•	Experience with DevOps, CI/CD pipelines, or Power BI API automation
•	Contributions to the Power BI community (e.g., GitHub, blogs, forums)

NOTE: NO AGENCIES AND DO NOT REACH OUT TO ME DIRECTLY OUTSIDE OF UPWORK.

The platform can provide additional resources and training to further enhance the candidate's skills in Power BI development, making it a great fit for outreach.

title: Mobile App Developer Needed: Convert Lovable Project to iOS App
description:
Mobile App Developer Needed: Convert Lovable Project to iOS App
Project Overview
I have an existing project built with Lovable (a React-based application) and need to convert it into a native iOS mobile application using Capacitor. The goal is to get a fully functional iOS app that utilizes the same Supabase backend as the current web project and is ready for submission to the Apple App Store.

This will be a fixed-price project, and payment will be made upon successful completion and delivery of a working iOS app.

Project Deliverables
The successful freelancer will be responsible for the following steps:

Export from Lovable & Initial Setup:

Export the Lovable project to GitHub (I will provide access to the repository).

Pull the project locally.

Install all necessary dependencies (npm install).

iOS Platform Integration:

Add the iOS platform to the project (npx cap add ios).

Update the iOS platform (npx cap update ios).

Build the project (npm run build).

Synchronize the web project with the native iOS project (npx cap sync).

Local iOS App Execution:

Successfully run the app on an iOS simulator or a physical iOS device (npx cap run ios). I will require a demonstration of the working app.

App Store Readiness (Configuration within Xcode):

Configure signing within Xcode (I will provide access to my Apple Developer account for this step, or guidance if preferred).

Assist with setting up app icons within Xcode (I will provide the icon assets).

Ensure the Capacitor config's app ID and name are correctly aligned for App Store deployment.

Important Notes
Mac and Xcode Required: The developer must have access to a Mac with Xcode installed to complete this project.

Supabase Backend: The existing Supabase backend is already compatible and will work seamlessly with the iOS app. No changes to the backend are anticipated.

Future Updates: After any future code changes to the web project, running npx cap sync will update the native app. While not part of this specific fixed-price project, understanding this process is crucial.

Reference: The Lovable detailed mobile development guide can be found here: https://lovable.dev/blogs/TODO (for your reference, not necessarily for the freelancer unless they need it).

Ideal Candidate
The ideal candidate will have:

Proven experience with Capacitor for mobile app development.

Experience in converting React-based web applications to mobile apps.

Proficiency in iOS development and working with Xcode.

A strong understanding of the App Store submission process.

Excellent communication skills and attention to detail.

I'm not technical so I'll need someone who can explain any questions in non-technical terms. 

Please provide your fixed-price bid for completing all the steps outlined above. If you have any questions or require further clarification, feel free to ask.
ai_remark: This job aligns well with the UI/UX Designing service because as a Mobile App Developer, the successful freelancer will need to ensure that the iOS app maintains a seamless and visually appealing user interface. By converting the existing project to a native iOS app, the freelancer will play a crucial role in designing and implementing the user experience for the app. With a score of 0 and being in the Yellow tier, this job would benefit from the expertise of a UI/UX designer to enhance the overall usability and aesthetics of the app.

-Hands-on experience with the Flutter front-end framework.

-Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
-Strong communication skills with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Fluent in English.

title: Frontend Developer Needed to Build Custom Loan Funnel (HTML/CSS/JavaScript)
description:
I'm looking for a skilled frontend developer to help me build a multi-step loan application quiz that integrates with a third-party loan provider/affiliate network via their API.

 I need help designing the form, creating the development and making it work dynamically with:

Custom input validation (e.g. enforcing 8-digit phone numbers, range restrictions, required fields)

Session storage and API communication (submitting the form to my affiliate networks API and storing the returned JWT + application ID in sessionStorage)

Dynamic redirection to step 2 only after a successful API response (Step 2 will be hosted on my website as well using their code)

So on the step 1 of the form we collect email, name, phone number, loan amount etc, and then we will send the data to the affilaite network through API, and if the affiliate network wants the lead we will send them to step 2, also on my page which will be a longer form that will autofill the initial information they gave us in step 1. If the network don't want the lead, we will ping another network, to see if they want it using their API, and if they also dont want it we send them to another page that doesn't require any autofill.

It need to also work with:

Pixel and tracking readiness (Meta, Google Tag)

The funnel needs to:

Use custom design (not template-based – pixel-perfect front end is key. I already have pictures of how I want it to be tho. It's a very very simple form. Should not take long to create)

Validate fields like email, phone, loan amount (min / max )

Call My two affiliate networks API on form submit (POST request, as documented here: [API docs will be shared])

Store session data (JWT and ApplicationID)

Redirect to next quiz step (e.g. step2.html) after API success

Be mobile responsive

Work inside GoHighLevel using custom code blocks or via external hosting

Include checkboxes for marketing consent

Tech Stack:

HTML / CSS / Vanilla JavaScript

Must work within GoHighLevel or externally hosted and embedded

Bonus if you have experience with affiliate tracking / attribution logic

To apply, please:

Share examples of similar work

Tell me how you'd approach this project technically (at a high level)

Include the word “LAAN” at the top of your application so I know you read this

Looking forward to working with a detail-oriented dev who understands both design and performance.

```
 count(distinct) as alias2
from table1
join table2 on (table1.id = table2.id)
left join table3 on (table2.id = table3.id)
where
 table1.column1 == “string”
 and table2.column1 in @variable1
```

title: Custom Web App for Event Guest Registration with QR Entry + Raffle Module Future iOS/Android Support
description:
We’re looking to build a custom web application that will be used to register guests for events, generate QR codes for check-in, and later be extended to include customizable raffle draws and additional modules.
This is Phase 1 of a larger system, and while this job focuses on the web platform, the solution must be designed with future iOS and Android app development in mind (React Native or Flutter compatibility preferred).
 
Phase 1 Requirements (Web App)
🎟️ Guest Registration
•	Admin panel to create/manage multiple events
•	Dynamic registration pages per event
•	Customizable form fields (name, email, etc.)
•	Auto-generation of unique QR codes upon registration
•	Email/SMS delivery of QR codes to users
✅ Check-In System
•	Admin login to access check-in interface
•	Scan QR via webcam or mobile browser camera
•	Mark guests as checked in, with visual feedback
•	Real-time sync with backend (with basic offline fallback)
 
Phase 2 Roadmap:
🎁 Raffle Draw System
•	Define eligibility (checked-in guests, filters, etc.)
•	Add multiple prizes and draw rules
•	Visualized random winner selection
•	Winner log + optional email/SMS notification
 
Technical Expectations:
•	Scalable architecture (multi-event, multi-admin)
•	Responsive and clean UI
•	Reusable modular backend (Node.js, Django, or similar)
•	Future-proof structure for mobile extension (React Native preferred)
•	QR code generation and validation logic
•	Secure data handling, especially for guest info
•	Realtime database or syncing capability (Firebase, Supabase, etc.)
 
Deliverables for This Job:
•	Fully functional web-based guest registration and check-in system
•	Admin dashboard
•	Basic UI/UX styling (we will provide branding if needed)
•	Technical documentation for future mobile app development
 
What We’re Looking For:
•	Experience with similar event or registration platforms
•	Strong full-stack skills (frontend + backend)
•	Forward-thinking development approach (reusability and modularity)
•	Clear communication and clean documentation
•	Ability to scale with us as features evolve
 
To Apply:
Please include:
•	Relevant past work (especially QR, event, or check-in systems)
•	Your preferred stack and reasoning
•	Timeline to deliver Phase 1
•	Any ideas or considerations you'd suggest based on the above

Please answer screening questions along with these:

1. What considerations would you make for real-time check-in tracking, especially in low connectivity environments (e.g., offline fallback)?

2. How do you handle user data security and privacy in public-facing applications like this?

3. Are you comfortable providing clean documentation and basic instructions to help onboard other developers later (e.g., for the mobile app build)?

MUST INCLUDE: APPROXIMATE DURATION AND APPROXIMATE COST OF THE PROJECT BASED ON YOUR UNDERSTANDING OF THE ABOVE. ANY VARIATIONS OR EXTRAS UPON DISCUSSIONS CAN BE RE-ADDRESSED. IF THIS IS NOT INCLUDED, WE WILL NOT REVIEW THE SUBMISSION.

PLEASE DON'T SHARE PREVIOUS SIMILAR WORK WHERE YOU ONLY DID MINOR WORK OR ONLY DESIGN WORK.

description:
I have a knowledge base text document which contains a series of rules related to managing performance marketing ad campaigns on Facebook/Instagram. 

These rules contain specific instructions related to when to scale ad campaigns, what metrics to track over different time periods, and what optimizations to make based on these metrics changes.

The knowledge base will be used as an input, along with an export of trailing 30-day Facebook ad data, for an AI model (ideally a CustomGPT or a Gem) to analyze. The AI model should return recommendations based on the ad data and knowledge base rules. 

The ad data is a multivariate dataset of ad spend, purchases, clicks, impressions, etc., broken down by Campaign, Adset, Ad, and Date dimensions.

I am struggling to get a CustomGPT or Gem to properly parse and analyze the dataset, and to apply the rules in the knowledge base. 

I need an expert to help me do the following:
1. Review and optimize the Knowledge Base document for clarity
2. Review and optimize the Multivariate Dataset, and make suggestions for a better ingestion format (if necessary)
3. Review the instructions I give the CustomGPT on how to handle the Dataset and the Knowledge Base, and optimize those instructions

You should be experienced in CustomGPT development, AI prompting, and data ingestion for AI models.

title: Set up n8n workflow
description:
I want to use n8n to build an automation for listing digital codes to my website. 

In this project we will feed image files into a Google Drive folder. We want to use OCR to read those images for their digital code. We want to add those to an excel sheet and tie that to the Google Drive image. Then we want to use ai to go to the Movies Anywhere redeem page and check those codes to see if they work. We do not want to redeem the codes just check if they are working. Once the code and title for the movie has been confirmed we will find the TT code for the movie from the IMDB website. Then we will list it to a WooCommerce backend for sale.

This is how GPT says to tackle the project, but I would default to your judgement. 

Trigger: Image Upload to Google Drive

OCR: Extract Code from Image

Log: Append Code and Image Link to Excel/Sheet

Verify Code via Movies Anywhere

Scrape Title & Find IMDb TT Code

Post to WooCommerce via API

Step 1: Trigger on New Google Drive Upload
n8n Node: Google Drive Trigger

Action: Fires when new image file is uploaded to a specific folder

Step 2: OCR to Extract Code from Image
Model Options:

Google Cloud Vision API (Best Quality)

Tesseract.js (Open-source, but lower accuracy)

n8n Node: HTTP Request or Custom Function Node (for Vision API)

What to extract: Alphanumeric string (typical digital code format)

Step 3: Log Code & Image Reference to Spreadsheet
Destination: Google Sheet or Excel (OneDrive)

n8n Nodes:

Google Sheets → “Append Row” with:

Filename

Detected Code

Drive Link

(Empty columns for title, TT code, verified? etc.)

Step 4: Verify Code on Movies Anywhere
⚠️ Important: You must mimic a browser session without submitting the redemption.

Approach:

Use Puppeteer or Playwright outside n8n to simulate the browser

Or try a headless browser via n8n's [Execute Command] node with a script

Goal: Input code, observe UI response ("Invalid" vs. "Valid for Movie X")

Model: Use a lightweight image classifier (optional) or regex to extract the title from result

Step 5: Find IMDb TT Code for the Movie
Option 1: Use IMDb Search API

3rd party APIs like OMDb API

Input movie title → Get IMDb ID (tt#######)

Option 2: Scrape IMDb directly (e.g., with serpapi or headless browser)

Step 6: Post to WooCommerce
n8n Node: WooCommerce

Method: POST

Data:

Title

Code (as custom field or private note)

IMDb ID

Price

Category

Stock quantity: 1

Image (optional, via GDrive link)

title: Mobile App Reverse Engineer
description:

We're looking for a skilled Mobile App Reverse Engineer to analyze, dissect, and enhance our current mobile application. You will play a critical role in ensuring the security and robustness of our app through advanced reverse engineering techniques.

Key Responsibilities:

Perform reverse engineering on mobile applications (Android/iOS).

Conduct security audits related to OpenID integrations, ensuring secure and compliant implementations.

Analyze certificate-pinned applications, identify vulnerabilities, and suggest improvements.

Work extensively with rooted devices and implement robust root-detection and prevention strategies.

Collaborate closely with development teams to enhance application security and performance.

Requirements:

Proven expertise in reverse engineering of Android/iOS mobile applications.

In-depth knowledge of OpenID Connect and OAuth security protocols.

Experience handling certificate-pinned applications and related security measures.

title: Full-Stack Developer Needed to Finalize Production Website (Vercel + Next.js + Supabase)
description:
📌 Project Overview:
I’ve already designed and built the front-end of a website on v0.dev (Vercel + Next.js). The platform connects barbers with clients, and the main feature is allowing barbers to sign up, pay a listing fee, and have their profile visible to clients.

I now need an experienced full-stack developer to complete the backend and critical functionality so that the platform can go live.

✅ What Needs to Be Done (Scope of Work):
1. Database Integration (CRITICAL)
Replace mock data with a real database (preferably Supabase or Neon)

Migrate all barber applications, profiles, and analytics to the persistent DB

Update all functions to interact with the database instead of mock data

2. File Storage Setup (CRITICAL)
Store uploaded files (barber ID, certificates, profile photos, etc.) in cloud storage like Vercel Blob, Supabase Storage, or AWS S3

Ensure uploaded files are displayed properly in profiles

3. Authentication System
Replace hardcoded login with a secure authentication flow (e.g. Supabase Auth or NextAuth.js)

4. Admin Panel Security
Strengthen admin access (avoid single environment password, add hashed login or MFA)

5. Payment Integration
Implement payment system for barbers to pay a £50 one-time listing fee and £30/month subscription

Use Stripe (preferred) or similar

Handle webhooks to update barber status after payment

6. Legal & Policy Pages
Add Terms of Service, Privacy Policy, and Refund Policy to the site

7. Deployment Tasks
Configure Vercel environment properly (API keys, DB connections, domain setup)

Add logging and error monitoring (Sentry/LogRocket optional)

8. Performance & Optimization
Optimize images, implement lazy loading, and configure backup strategy

9. Testing Before Launch
Full functional testing of client/browsing, barber sign-up, login, payment

Payment sandbox testing

Security & device testing

⚙️ Tech Stack Preference:
Next.js / React

Supabase / PostgreSQL

Stripe

Vercel (project already deployed on Vercel)

Optional: NextAuth.js, Sentry, Zod

🕒 Deadline:
Looking to launch ASAP — please include your estimated timeline for completing this scope.

💬 How to Apply:
Please reply with:

Your experience with similar projects

Estimated timeframe and cost

Any clarifying questions

title: Microsoft Sharepoint Intranet
description:
Creating an intranet on Microsoft SharePoint to host training videos for a company. Here are some features to include:
	1	Video Library:
	◦	Dedicated Video Library: Create a specific library for training videos, with organized folders and metadata tagging for easy navigation.
	◦	Metadata Tags: Use tags like "Beginner," "Advanced," "Installation," "Design," etc., to help employees quickly find relevant content.
	2	User-Friendly Interface:
	◦	Intuitive Navigation: Design the homepage with easy-to-access links to video libraries, training schedules, and support resources.
	◦	Search Functionality: Implement a robust search function that allows users to find videos by keywords, tags, or categories.
	3	Permissions and Access Control:
	◦	Role-Based Access: Set permissions so that only employees can access the videos, with different access levels for managers, trainers, and trainees.
	◦	Security: Ensure videos are secure and cannot be downloaded or shared externally unless authorized.
	4	Responsive Design:
	◦	Mobile Access: Ensure the intranet is accessible on various devices, including desktops, tablets, and smartphones, for employees in the field.
	5	Integration with Microsoft Tools:
	◦	Teams Integration: Allow seamless integration with Microsoft Teams for discussions and Q&A sessions related to the training videos.
	◦	Outlook Calendar Integration: Sync training schedules with Outlook calendars to remind employees of upcoming training sessions.
	6	Interactive Features:
	◦	Quizzes and Assessments: Include quizzes or assessments after video modules to test knowledge retention.
	◦	Feedback and Comments: Enable a comments section for employees to ask questions or provide feedback on the videos.
	7	Analytics and Reporting:
	◦	Viewership Tracking: Track which videos are being watched, by whom, and for how long to gauge engagement and effectiveness.
	◦	Performance Reports: Generate reports on quiz results, video completion rates, and employee progress.
	8	Content Management:
	◦	Version Control: Maintain version control to ensure employees are watching the most up-to-date training videos.
	◦	Content Scheduling: Schedule the release of new training videos and archive outdated ones.
	9	Customization and Branding:
	◦	Company Branding: Customize the SharePoint site with the company’s branding, including logos, colors, and themes.
	◦	Personalized Dashboards: Allow employees to customize their dashboards to show relevant training materials and updates.

title: SaaS platform core functionality
description:

title: Creation and integration of Dokan on a multi-vendor Wordpress site
description:
Hello,

I need to create a marketplace website with the Dokan extension. I usually create e-commerce websites, so I can take care of the design and web design. I'm just having a lot of trouble getting to grips with Dokan, I can't customise it the way I want, I can't integrate it in the right way. When I create an account on the site (seller or buyer account) Dokan doesn't let me choose the password for my account, and when I enter forgotten password, no password is sent to me.

In short, I can do wordpress, but Dokan can't (lack of time).

If I provide you with all the necessary resources, do you think you'll be able to integrate Dokan into the site in the right way? The project is simple: to create a giant local marketplace for the island of Malta. Sellers simply need to create an account, publish their products and then be able to sell their products throughout Malta. Buyers need to be able to find their way around the site easily, and buy without difficulty.

Can you help me with this? And if so, how long would it take you, and how much would it cost me?

Thank you

title: Location tracking services
description:
